entry.title: EfficientFormer -- Vision Transformers at MobileNet Speed
entry.content:
Northeastern University

Abstract

VIR(Vision Transformers)

network architecture searchMobileNet blockVIT

ok MobileNet

,

fastest model, EfficientFormer-L1, 79.2% top-1 accuracy on ImageNet-1K with only 1.6 ms inference latency on iPhone 12 (compiled with CoreML), which runs as fast as MobileNetV21.4 (1.6 ms, 74.7% top-1), and our largest model, EfficientFormer-L7, obtains 83.3% accuracy with only 7.0 ms latency

Introduction

transformer &

  • some efforts consider designing new architectures or operations by changing the linear layers with convolutional layers (CONV)
  • combining self-attention with MobileNet blocks
  • introducing sparse attention to reduce the computational cost
  • efforts leverage network searching algorithm or pruning to improve efficiency

  • VIT latency analysis iPhone12CoreML as the compiler
  • VIR dimension-consistent design paradigm for vision transformers
  • latency-driven slimming method EfficientFormers

Related Work

On-Device Latency Analysis of Vision Transformers

  1. Patch embedding with large kernel and stride is a speed bottleneck on mobile devices

    large kernel and stridePatch embedding( DeiT-S PoolForm-S24)( LeViT-256 EfficientForm) Patch embedding

Latency , Patch embedding

  1. Consistent feature dimension is important for the choice of token mixer. MHSA is not necessarily a speed bottleneck.

token mixerspooling and MHSA

  • PoolFormer-s24 LeViT-256 LeViT-256

  • reshapeMHSA 3D DeiT-Small ViT ( LeViT-256)

dimension-consistent network4D 3D MHSAreshape

  1. CONV-BN is more latency-favorable than LN (GN)-Linear and the accuracy drawback is generally acceptable

CONV-BN is more latency favorable because BN can be folded into the preceding convolution for inference speedup, while dynamic normalizations, such as LN and GN, still collects running statistics at the inference phase, thus contributing to latency

  1. The latency of nonlinearity is hardware and compiler dependent

We conclude that nonlinearity should be determined on a case-by-case basis given specific hardware and compiler at hand.

Design of EfficientFormer

patch embedding

https://www.pinecone.io/learn/vision-transformers/
